title: Rose McGowan’s infamous naked VMAs dress was a response to sexual assault
text:
Rose’s dress has gone down in red carpet history (Picture: Ron Galella/WireImage)

Rose McGowan’s entirely see-through dress at the 1998 MTV Video Music Awards is one of the most iconic red carpet looks of all time.

And 21 years on, the actress has revealed the dress was meant as a response to a sexual assault.

Rose had been in a number of films by the time the 1998 VMAs came around, including Scream, and attended on the arm of then-boyfriend Marilyn Manson.

But while the shock rocker was set to perform The Dope Show on the night, it was Rose’s revealing dress that made headlines.

The Charmed star wore a beaded black mesh dress which was entirely see-through at the front, and made up of frayed strings at the back.

Rose wore the dress to make a statement (Picture: Ron Galella/WireImage)

And while Rose wore an animal print thong, she opted to go braless, so was nearly naked on the red carpet.

Speaking on Jameela Jamil’s I Weigh podcast, Rose explained that the 1999 VMAs was her first public appearance since being raped, and that she wanted to make a statement.

The 45-year-old said: ‘I [wore] that for a reason. It was my first public appearance after being raped. And I thought, it was kind of like Russell Crowe and Gladiator when it comes out in the ring and he’s like, “Are you not entertained?”

‘And that was why I did that. That was my response to being assaulted.’

Rose alleges that she was raped by Harvey Weinstein (Picture: Dave Benett/Getty Images)

Rose previously told Dr Oz that the dress was a ‘political statement’, saying: ‘ Of course, there was no Twitter at the time or Instagram, no way to speak for yourself.’

McGowan alleges that she was raped by Harvey Weinstein at the Sundance Film Festival in 1997.

In her autobiography Brave, McGowan refers to the shamed producer as ‘the Monster’ and alleges that after discussing her career in his hotel career, Weinstein held her down on the edge of a jacuzzi and raped her.

She wrote: ‘I felt so dirty. I had been so violated and I was sad to the core of my being. I kept thinking about how he’d been sitting behind me in the theater the night before it happened. Which made it – not my responsibility, exactly, but – like I had had a hand in tempting him. Which made it even sicker and made me feel dirtier.’

Weinstein has been accused of assault and sexual misconduct by over 80 women, and could face life in prison after being charged with five counts of sexual abuse, including rape.
